title: If Yordles Mimic the Society They Grow Up Around...
body:
What is {{champion:45}} mimicing?

Edit:
Reference for what other yordles are influenced by-

{{champion:105}} - The Ocean/Bilgewater

replies.body: Now THERE is a question.
https://i.imgur.com/XRYM5KT.gif?noredirect
I feel a story coming on.
When you remember that Bandle city is getting lore update
Is that confirmed?
Mordekaiser era Noxus?

Since Yordles are ancient, Veigar could technically be affected by original Mordekaiser's empire, right?
Imgine Veigar and Morde, conquering the world side by side.
Noxus would be powerless against such absurdity.
Rito plz.

With how much you never explained about the new Yordle lore, most of what's currently _accepted_ is fan-built. Dunno if that was the intention but it has got confusing to say the least.

What OP's post makes me thing is that you've not been able to give Bandle a culture of their own, and all we get is yordles imitating other nations and I'm really not a fan of that.

Isn't it more that they are attracted to certain societies that fit their personality, not mimicing? Else Kled wouldn't be moaning about how modern day Noxans aren't real Noxans.

It would also mean that any Yordle still in the city would be mimicing Yordle society that that just doesn't make sense.

It's likely the case to an extent, but it could be that yordles more "manifest" as the pure ideals of certain societies, but do not change after manifesting and finding their calling. Therefore, Kled could have manifested around old Noxus, but new Noxus he doesn't like.

Maybe but that just sounds like it's taking away from their own personalities. Heimer isn't a genius who sought other intellectuals of the world to better himself in a society filled with like minded people, he's a Yordle that's just clever because he's in Piltover. That destroys his character.

Ziggs on the other hand according to the comic went with his mentor Heimer to Piltover as they were both scientists, however Ziggs didn't feel at home in Piltover because his type of science is more reckless, so he was attracted to Zaun.

Eh, I'm not a Red though. We don't know much about the exact nature of yordles in the new lore, but we do know society can heavily shape who they are and where they are, much more so than an average human.

I know, just making conversation. :)

Yordle lore is long time coming, from their 'glamour' to why they are more myth than reality yet are right in front of people, lots more needs to be explained and/or explored. I just don't want this new lore to destroy who the Yordles are as people. To hint that their personalities are so easily shaped by that which is around them, takes away from their individual personalities, what makes them them. I mean, if that is the case, put Teemo in Zaun for long enough, he'll become like Ziggs? Not a yordle with great bravery, conviction and determination but reckless, pushing the boundries for personal gain?

I dont think thats true.  Most of the Yordles live in Bandle city, 3 of ours live therr Teemo Tristana and Rumble.  Kled is just Crazy, Kennen was indoctrinated, Lulu is... lulu.  I think veigar really was just mentally tortured until he broke.
Clearly he grew up in a house with a Yasuo main.
well he WANTED to
But unlike you, he has no key.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=tNQxJtjy,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2018-03-16T13:38:41.639+0000)
>
> But unlike you, he has no key.

You win the internet
He couldn't reach the doorknob because he was too short

Evil.

Also keep in mind that Veigar does not live among humans.
Then wouldn't he mimic nature and be a druid or whatever Teemo is?

We could assume that's what happened with {{champion:117}}.  Similar deal to {{champion:45}} minus all the evil and insanity from being imprisoned; likely the reason they're listed as "friends" according to the wiki.
Actually they're listed as friends because the moment she was revealed just about everyone shipped them.
That doesn't dismiss my point
Your apparent point is that they may be friends due to similar lives.   But thats wrong its because theyre commonly shipped together.
You're not examining my point at all; regardless if they were made friends because of it being a popular ship, they do have common ground in both being outcasts from other yordles.

I doubt he'd be something like a druid,considering that other bandle champs don't seem closely connected to nature as well.

Also Vegiar is likely an outcast in Bandlecity anyway,so that would explain why he's different.
Teemo isn't a druid he's a war veteran.
he was imprisoned and went insane
According to the old lore, anyway. It may have changed when the IoW was retconned.
I actually never noticed that before. His lore says he was imprisoned in Noxus. So let's say he is mimicking the black rose part of noxua.

Most likely Noxus.

He has an ideal that strength triumphs all and has great ambitions of conquer and bringing nations to their knees. Seems very likely derived from a Noxian ideal, even if he doesn't live in Noxus.
I lean myself more towards Mordekaizer's rule... more emphasis on evil
He's mimicking the Void. Just look how purple he is

But....he is blue not purple....
http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-mMV5yy0v2ME/VMqRCyn77YI/AAAAAAAAi9Q/oKeELBKlT2Y/s1600/veigarbasecompare.jpg
Basically a mix
His lore said he was imprisoned so most likely he's mimicking he's jailers most likely because they were cruel and evil. One of his abilities is basically a cage.
{{champion:17}} - Hell
Its canon now
Evil and the thirst for more and more power

Well, if during his imprisonment by Noxus he was inside the Immortal Bastion, there was a giant bird daemon there until Swain took over.  A magical creature like a Yordle might make a special kind of treat for it to torment.  That’d explain the mental shift as his soul had been getting consumed slowly and imprinted on by an true darkness until he got out.

Question: If he controls celestial magic such as dark mater and planer rifts, does that put him up there in power with Aurelion Sol, the Void and Mt. Targon?
He was kept in isolation. Locked up. Drove him insane.

I believe that Teemo and Trist are purely influenced by Bandle City, since I don't think they have any other connection with another place. The same, I think, goes for Rumble but I don't really know his lore.

What if Veigar's "imprinting" pre-dates Noxus and is actually derived from Mordekaiser's rule?

Btw your list is missing {{champion:42}}, who, just like Teemo, Tristana and Rumble, is more connected to Bandle City than the rest of the world.
The void, right?

Himself.
Isn’t the lore that he was captured and left in solitary confinement for years?
What does teemo mimic? He's OK outside of combat but is a stone cold killer inside of a combat situation.  Where'd that come from?

_"If Yordles Mimic the Society They Grow Up Around..."_

Where does it say that? I wasn't aware.

A couple Rioters have mentioned it when questioned about yordles over the many yordle discussions since the big lore revamp. It was shown a bit in the Poppy rework, more in the Kled release, and then a few other bits scattered here and there. I would link a source, but I don't want to find the couple threads it was brought up in. I hope the Red Comment here is proof enough.
Thank you. I'm just a bit on the fence with the idea. Makes it feel like there's no _identity_ to Bandle City or the species as a whole, just Yordles imitating what's around them.
